message:
Hi guys,

I've an EC2 instance (ubuntu based) with a root volume.

1- I've created a snapshot of the root volume. 
2- Then created a new volume from the snapshot. 
3- Then created a new empty volume and formatted it as ext4 file system. 
4- Then copied all the files from the snap volume to the new empty volume via "sudo rsync -aHAXxSP". 
5- Then attached the new volume as root volume "/dev/sda1". 

The problem was that the instance is getting "initialising" state then turing to "stop" state. anyone have any clue?

data.message: open the console or whatever its name in EC2 to see what happens while the booting

You need to install grub boot loader 
Coping files will not install the boot loader

I mean the boot loader itself , not the grub package , 
The command that do this is grub-install ithink
Did you make sure that you de attached the original volume as maybe the both trying to access at the same time
